text: The Chastity Arch for Qiu Liang-gong's Mother () is a paifang in Jincheng Township, Kinmen, Taiwan. ==History== Qiu Liang-gong was born in Kinmen. His father died 35 days after his birth, leaving his mother alone to raise him. Qiu grew up later to become a military officer in the navy. His mother was then honored and the arch was constructed for her in 1812. ==Architecture== The arch is a four-pillar, three-section stone structure made of granite and limestone. There are four pairs of stone lions located at the front and back sides of the pillar. ==See also== * List of tourist attractions in Taiwan ==References== Category:1812 establishments in China Category:Buildings and structures in Kinmen County Category:Gates in Taiwan Category:National monuments of Taiwan
